description:
To reprod : nosetests  nosetests tempest.api.compute.servers.test_virtual_interfaces.py:VirtualInterfacesTestXML.test_list_virtual_interfaces in a devstack+quantum environment

The test triggers a 500 error code
"ComputeFault: Got compute fault
Details: The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation."
where it expects a 200.

The test makes the following request : GET http://XX/v2/$Tenant/servers/$server_id/os-virtual-interfaces
This HTTP request calls the Quantum API (nova/nova/network/quantumv2/api.py) and specificaly the get_vifs_by_* methods which are not implemented (raise NotImplementedError())

I suggest to skip this test if Quantum is enabled as set in Tempest configuration.
title: list_virtual_interfaces fails with Quantum

comments.content:
The test triggers a 500 error code
"ComputeFault: Got compute fault
Details: The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation."
where it expects a 200.


The test makes the following request : GET http://XX/v2/$Tenant/servers/$server_id/os-virtual-interfaces 
This HTTP request calls the Quantum API (nova/nova/network/quantumv2/api.py) and specificaly the get_vifs_by_* methods which are not implemented (raise NotImplementedError())

I suggest to skip this test if Quantum is enabled as set in Tempest configuration.

    Skip list_vifs test with Quantum
    
    Currently Quantum doesn't support all the features provided
    by nova-network. Thus some tests related to features not
    available in Quantum API must be skipped.
    
    Fix Bug #1183436

comments.content:
I've added nova to this bug since it's an interop issue in the nova API that it works for nova-network but not neutron as the network backend. This would have to probably be resolved as a blueprint, it might even require a microversion to signal the change, so a spec would be needed for newton.

But since you can attach/detach vifs with the nova API using neutron as the backend, I think you should be able to list them also.

Nova does have a 'no more API proxy' policy, but I think that really only applies to new APIs, I think we need to have API parity with nova-network and neutron if we're striving for interop.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

commit cae96dccaff6d11e8dbd0e043676eb86e6fe73d8
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Sun Mar 6 14:35:26 2016 -0500

    Return 400 for os-virtual-interfaces when using Neutron
    
    If using the Neutron network API, listing VIFs will return
    a 500. This changes that to return a 400, which does not
    require a microversion according to our docs:
    
    http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_dev.html
    
    A later change will introduce a microversion to implement the
    method for the Neutron API.
    
    Change-Id: I27f48b38d64b34277f001fba86b4e64e9ead937c
    Related-Bug: #1183436
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>

    Return 400 for os-virtual-interfaces when using Neutron
    
    If using the Neutron network API, listing VIFs will return
    a 500. This changes that to return a 400, which does not
    require a microversion according to our docs:
    
    http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_dev.html
    
    A later change will introduce a microversion to implement the

commit b472f7554e9905b93875bfb85e417775462b2eae
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Sun Mar 6 14:35:26 2016 -0500

    Return 400 for os-virtual-interfaces when using Neutron
    
    If using the Neutron network API, listing VIFs will return
    a 500. This changes that to return a 400, which does not
    require a microversion according to our docs:
    
    http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_dev.html
    
    A later change will introduce a microversion to implement the
    method for the Neutron API.
    
    Conflicts:
            nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/virtual_interfaces.py
            nova/api/openstack/compute/virtual_interfaces.py
            nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_virtual_interfaces.py
    
    NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the module paths moving in
    Liberty and the fake HTTPRequest didn't have the wsgi_api_version kwarg
    in Kilo.
    
    Change-Id: I27f48b38d64b34277f001fba86b4e64e9ead937c
    Related-Bug: #1183436
    (cherry picked from commit cae96dccaff6d11e8dbd0e043676eb86e6fe73d8)
    (cherry picked from commit c5da5d05763133b52cc9f3bf60884195c9dcab16)

commit 858e7200348040f686d8877ee03787bbbc638c2b
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Sat Mar 5 21:41:52 2016 -0500

    Unskip test_list_virtual_interfaces
    
    Nova will return a 400 in the case of using Neutron as the
    network API. Remove the skip such that a 400 is expected in
    the case of using Neutron, else it's a failure.
    
    Nova will implement the API for neutron in a microversion.
    
    Depends-On: I27f48b38d64b34277f001fba86b4e64e9ead937c
    
    Change-Id: I409fc6349a40396be68796fc82e5c1f37242bbdb
    Related-Bug: #1183436
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Given nova-network is deprecated and we agreed at the Austin summit [1] to not proxy anymore network APIs to Neutron, I'm going to abandon this spec.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-nova-neutron
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

Review: https://review.openstack.org/288965

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-nova-neutron
